pythagoras.d
Class AffineTransform

java.lang.Object
  pythagoras.d.AffineTransform
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class AffineTransform
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Serializable

Represents a 2D affine transform, which performs a linear mapping that preserves the straightness and parallelness of lines. See http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/awt/geom/AffineTransform.html

See Also:
Serialized Form

setToIdentity

public void setToIdentity()
Sets this transform to the identity transform. Any existing transform values are overwritten.

setToTranslation

public void setToTranslation(double tx,
                             double ty)
Sets this transform to a simple translation using the supplied values. Any existing transform values are overwritten.

setToRotation

public void setToRotation(double angle)
Sets this transform to a simple rotation using the supplied values. Any existing transform values are overwritten.

Parameters:
angle - the angle of rotation (in radians).

setToRotation

public void setToRotation(double angle,
                          double px,
                          double py)
Sets this transform to a simple rotation using the supplied values. Any existing transform values are overwritten.

Parameters:
angle - the angle of rotation (in radians).
px - the x-coordinate of the point around which to rotate.
py - the y-coordinate of the point around which to rotate.

createInverse

public AffineTransform createInverse(AffineTransform target)
                              throws NoninvertibleTransformException
Computes the inverse of this transform and stores it in the supplied target.

Returns:
the supplied target.
Throws:
NoninvertibleTransformException - if this transform cannot be inverted.

createInverse

public AffineTransform createInverse()
                              throws NoninvertibleTransformException
Computes and returns the inverse of this transform.

Returns:
the supplied target.
Throws:
NoninvertibleTransformException - if this transform cannot be inverted.

transform

public Point transform(IPoint src,
                       Point dst)
Transforms the supplied point using this transform's matrix.

Parameters:
src - the point to be transformed.
dst - the point in which to store the transformed values, if null a new instance will be created. May be src.
Returns:
the supplied (or created) destination point.

transform

public void transform(IPoint[] src,
                      int srcOff,
                      Point[] dst,
                      int dstOff,
                      int length)
Transforms the supplied points using this transform's matrix.

Parameters:
src - the points to be transformed.
srcOff - the offset into the src array at which to start.
dst - the points into which to store the transformed points. May be src.
dstOff - the offset into the dst array at which to start.
length - the number of points to transform.

transform

public void transform(double[] src,
                      int srcOff,
                      double[] dst,
                      int dstOff,
                      int length)
Transforms the supplied points using this transform's matrix.

Parameters:
src - the points to be transformed (as [x, y, x, y, ...]).
srcOff - the offset into the src array at which to start.
dst - the points into which to store the transformed points. May be src.
dstOff - the offset into the dst array at which to start.
length - the number of points to transform.

deltaTransform

public Point deltaTransform(IPoint src,
                            Point dst)
Transforms the supplied relative distance vector (ignores the translation component).

Parameters:
src - the point to be transformed.
dst - the point in which to store the transformed values, if null a new instance will be created. May be src.
Returns:
the supplied (or created) destination point.

deltaTransform

public void deltaTransform(double[] src,
                           int srcOff,
                           double[] dst,
                           int dstOff,
                           int length)
Transforms the supplied relative distance vectors using this transform's matrix (ignores the translation component).

Parameters:
src - the points to be transformed (as [x, y, x, y, ...]).
srcOff - the offset into the src array at which to start.
dst - the points into which to store the transformed points. May be src.
dstOff - the offset into the dst array at which to start.
length - the number of points to transform.

inverseTransform

public Point inverseTransform(IPoint src,
                              Point dst)
                       throws NoninvertibleTransformException
Transforms the supplied point using the inverse of this transform's matrix.

Parameters:
src - the point to be transformed.
dst - the point in which to store the transformed values, if null a new instance will be created. May be src.
Returns:
the supplied (or created) destination point.
Throws:
NoninvertibleTransformException

                             int srcOff,
                             double[] dst,
                             int dstOff,
                             int length)
                      throws NoninvertibleTransformException

Parameters:
src - the points to be transformed (as [x, y, x, y, ...]).
srcOff - the offset into the src array at which to start.
dst - the points into which to store the transformed points. May be src.
dstOff - the offset into the dst array at which to start.
length - the number of points to transform.

NoninvertibleTransformException
